name: Honda CB Hornet 160R CBS
short_description: Honda CB Hornet 160R CBS - A muscular streetfighter with aggressive styling, refined 160cc engine, and CBS braking system for confident city riding.

faqs.question: Difference between CBS and ABS?
faqs.answer: CBS links both brakes when one is applied, while ABS prevents wheel lock-up.

short_description: Honda CB Shine SP - A premium 125cc commuter bike with refined engine, comfortable ergonomics and sporty styling elements.

faqs.question: Difference from standard Shine?
faqs.answer: SP has sportier graphics, better suspension and premium finish.

faqs.answer: SP 160 has more aggressive styling and premium features.

short_description: Honda X-Blade - A futuristic streetfighter with sharp styling, 160cc engine and aggressive riding position.

short_description: Honda X-Blade ABS - The premium variant of X-Blade with single-channel ABS for enhanced safety and braking performance.

faqs.question: Difference from non-ABS?
faqs.answer: Adds ABS and slightly heavier, otherwise identical.

name: Honda CB150R Exmotion
short_description: The Honda CB150R Exmotion is a stylish, high-performance naked sports bike featuring modern design, reliable performance, and advanced technology, perfect for urban riding and young enthusiasts in Bangladesh.
description: The Honda CB150R Exmotion is a premium naked street bike combining sportiness with modern design. It comes equipped with a 149cc liquid-cooled DOHC engine, offering smooth power delivery and an aggressive riding stance. Inspired by the Neo Sports Café concept, the Exmotion features LED lighting, an inverted front fork, and a fully digital instrument panel. Built on a lightweight frame, it provides excellent handling, making it ideal for both daily rides and spirited performance. It’s one of the most feature-rich 150cc bikes available in Bangladesh with an impressive blend of style, safety, and efficiency.
cons: Pillion seat is not very comfortable

faqs.question: Is Honda CB150R Exmotion good for daily commuting?
faqs.answer: Yes, its lightweight frame and smooth performance make it ideal for daily city commuting.

faqs.question: Does it have dual-channel ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, the CB150R Exmotion comes equipped with dual-channel ABS.

faqs.question: What is the mileage of Honda CB150R Exmotion?
faqs.answer: It offers approximately 40 km/l under standard riding conditions.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for long rides?
faqs.answer: While it performs well, the small fuel tank and firm seat may make long-distance touring less comfortable.

faqs.question: Suitable for tall riders?
